readability_reflection: I found interpolation to be more readable despite not having much experience with it. Some examples I can think of from these questions would be number one. When using concatenation and ints, it became confusing on what exactly was a string and what was just a number. The addition operator made it more difficult to read compared to having braces.
comprehension_debugging: I feel like both had pros and cons. In some cases, I understood the snippets of code with concatenation, but as stated in the previous question, when numbers and ints started to get involved, it became more confusing, and I found myself preferring interpolation. Advantages I had experienced were my somewhat knowledge in concatenation and that's about it.
preference_rationale: I would choose interpolation for future programming tasks. Some specific factors include the use of curly braces to help distinguish it from concatenation, where as concatenation uses adding operator/
learning_curve: My previous understanding of string concatenation really benefitted me in the early questions, but after that, I wasn't too sure with my answers.
suggestions_improvement: I would say for concatenation for there to be a better way to distinguish it to just using the regular operator.
